source.0fcc6e19:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import os

bulletin_dir = "../input/cityofla/CityofLA/Job Bulletins"
data_list = []
for filename in os.listdir(bulletin_dir):
    with open(bulletin_dir + "/" + filename, 'r', errors='ignore') as f:
        for line in f.readlines():
            #Insert code to parse job bulletins
            if "Open Date:" in line:
                job_bulletin_date = line.split("Open Date:")[1].split("(")[0].strip()
        data_list.append([filename, job_bulletin_date])

df = pd.DataFrame(data_list)
df.columns = ["FILE_NAME", "OPEN_DATE"]
df.head()

Inspiration: ["Data Science for Good City of LA Starter Kernel"](https://www.kaggle.com/bbailey/data-science-for-good-city-of-la-starter-kernel) by BrendanGallegoBailey.

Here we're collecting data from all of the job bulletins and storing it in a CSV. We're only collecting two features here, but ideally your code would collect a lot more.
